page.title: 11TIXALL VILLAGE
page.content: Tixall is a small rural village with about 14 houses.The cottages are about 200 to 300 years old,and several are empty.Most of the village is owned by 2 local landowners. The old day school,now the village hall is used as a Sunday School by the church and as a playgroup. The playgroup has 12 to 20 children,but only 3 to 4 come from Tixall,most come from Great Haywood. A fete takes place once a year.The village hall is used for childrens parties,or the fete if it is raining. The church was built about 1600,and a service is held once every 2 weeks but only between 10 and 20 people attend. There are no shops since the post office closed in 1973,but a mobile libary,calls once every 2 weeks.There is a bus service into Stafford on Tuesdays,Fridays and Saturdays.
